derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Provençal gaf 'hook'; related to gaffe

entry.tran: （固定在桅杆上以支撑帆的）斜桁
entry.def: On a boat, a gaff is a pole which is attached to a mast in order to support a particular kind of sail.
A gaff is a pole with a point or hook at one end, which is used for catching large fish.

means.word_mean: 1. a spar rising aft from a mast to support the head of a quadrilateral fore-and-aft sail
2. an iron hook with a handle; used for landing large fish
